SharpMermaid
Table of Contents

Generate Physical Project Diagram

Description

As a developer,
I want to generate a diagram that reflects the solution structure on disk,
So that I can analyze and visualize project organization and dependencies.

Rules

The diagram must start with ```mermaid

The diagram must end with```

The diagram must begin with a graph declaration

The console must display a warning message "No projects found in the solution", when the solution contains no .csproj files

Diagram must have a title same as the solution name

The diagram may include a node for each project in the solution, with the same name as the project

  • If a single project is selected by the developer, a node must be included in the diagram
  • If multiple projects are selected by the developer, nodes must be included in the diagram
  • If no projects are selected, nodes must not be included in the diagram and the console must display a warning message "No projects found in the solution"

Relationships between projects may be shown with arrows

  • If a dependency exists, the relationship must be indicated with an arrow
  • If a dependency is bi-directional, the arrow must be <--> and a warning must be issued in the console
  • If a project has no dependencies, it must not display an arrow

Diagram may include a URL to the project's class diagram

  • If the developer has enabled class diagram URLs, the diagram must include a clickable URL for each project
    • Projects without .cs files must display a warning in the console, one per affected project.
  • If the developer has not enabled class diagram URLs, the diagram must not include any clickable URLs for projects

Each project node in the diagram may display all public top-level types defined within the project

  • If a developer has enabled public types, the node must display all public top-level types
    Supported types: classes, interfaces, structs, enums, records
    • If more than a single public top-level type exists in the same .cs file, a warning message must be displayed in the console
  • If the developer has not enabled public types, the node must not display any public types

Scenarios

Required Argument

Solution File Path (.sln) -> The tool needs to know what solution file to analyze.

yourtool path/to/solution.sln

Optional Arguments

To match the rules youï¿½ve set, consider adding these CLI flags:
--output -> Define a custom output file for the Mermaid diagram.

yourtool path/to/solution.sln --output diagram.md

--projects Project1,Project2 -> Specify which projects to include in the diagram.
--include-urls -> Enable clickable class diagram URLs in project nodes.
--include-public-types -> Show public top-level types in each project node.

Automatic Console Warnings

If no projects exist -> Show warning: "No projects found in the solution"
**If a .csproj file has no .cs files -> Show a warning for that project.`

Solution With Without Projects

Given the solution has no projects
When the diagram is generated
Then the diagram should have no nodes or dependencies
And And the title should be the solution name

Solution With Single Project

Given the solution has a single project
And the project has at least one source file
When the diagram is generated
Then the diagram should include one node
And the diagram should have a title same as the solution name
And the diagram should include a node for the project in the solution
And the diagram should include a url to the projects class diagram

Multiple Projects Without Dependencies

Given the solution has multiple projects with no dependencies
And each project has at least one source file When the diagram is generated
Then the diagram should include one node per project
And the diagram should have a title same as the solution name
And the diagram should include a url to the projects class diagram

Multiple Projects With Dependencies

Given the solution has multiple projects with dependencies
And each project has at least one source file
When the diagram is generated
Then the diagram should include one node per project
And arrows should represent the dependencies between project nodes
And each should include a url to the projects class diagram
And the diagram should have a title same as the solution name
And the diagram should include a url to the projects class diagram
